definition: lit. family shames must not be spread abroad (idiom)/fig. don't wash your dirty linen in public
pinyin: jia1 chou3 bu4 ke3 wai4 yang2

definition: home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 傢伙|家伙[jia1 huo5]
clown/2nd earthly branch: 1-3 a.m., 12th solar month (6th January to 3rd February), year of the Ox/ancient Chinese compass point: 30°
shameful/ugly/disgraceful
surname Chou
(negative prefix)/not/no
see 可汗[ke4 han2]
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
outside/in addition/foreign/external
abbr. for 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1]/surname Yang
to raise/to hoist/the action of tossing or winnowing/scattering (in the wind)/to flutter/to propagate
variant of 揚|扬[yang2]

sentences.english: Domestic violence is a family matter, do not wash dirty linen in public.
sentences.chinese: 家庭暴力是家务事，家丑不可外扬。

sentences.english: My father always says, "Domestic shame should not be published.
sentences.chinese: 我爸爸常说:“家丑不可外扬。”

definition: even an honest and upright official will have difficulty resolving a family dispute (proverb)
pinyin: qing1 guan1 nan2 duan4 jia1 wu4 shi4

definition: family scandal/skeleton in the closet
gossip is a fearful thing (idiom)
it is better to avoid unnecessary trouble (idiom)/the less complications the better
pinyin: duo1 yi1 shi4 bu4 ru2 shao3 yi1 shi4

definition: scandal
lit. one palm alone cannot clap (proverb)/fig. it takes two persons to start a dispute/it takes two to tango/it's difficult to achieve anything without support
pinyin: yi1 ge5 ba1 zhang3 pai1 bu4 xiang3

definition: Every family goes through its problems. (idiom)
pinyin: jia1 jia1 you3 ben3 nan2 nian4 de5 jing1

definition: to keep the peace; to patch up a quarrel (idiom)
family matters/domestic affairs/housework
lit. public opinion is powerful enough to melt metal (idiom)/fig. public clamor can obscure the actual truth/mass spreading of rumors can confuse right and wrong
It is better to squash enmity rather than keeping it alive (proverb)
pinyin: yuan1 jia1 yi2 jie3 bu4 yi2 jie2

definition: where it is possible to let people off, one should spare them (idiom); anyone can make mistakes, forgive them when possible
pinyin: de2 rao2 ren2 chu4 qie3 rao2 ren2

definition: to mediate/to urge peace
if revenge breeds revenge, will there ever be an end to it? (Buddhist saying)
pinyin: yuan1 yuan1 xiang1 bao4 he2 shi2 liao3

definition: harmony is to be prized
lit. paper can't wrap fire; fig. the truth will out
